drought.title: Drought
drought.description: Long lasting absence of precipitation affecting agriculture and livestock, and the overall availability of food and water.

dustHaze.title: Dust and Haze
dustHaze.description: Related to dust storms, air pollution and other non-volcanic aerosols. Volcano-related plumes shall be included with the originating eruption event.

earthquakes.title: Earthquakes
earthquakes.description: Related to all manner of shaking and displacement. Certain aftermath of earthquakes may also be found under landslides and floods.

floods.title: Floods
floods.description: Related to aspects of actual flooding--e.g., inundation, water extending beyond river and lake extents.

landslides.title: Landslides
landslides.description: Related to landslides and variations thereof: mudslides, avalanche.

manmade.title: Manmade
manmade.description: Events that have been human-induced and are extreme in their extent.

seaLakeIce.title: Sea and Lake Ice
seaLakeIce.description: Related to all ice that resides on oceans and lakes, including sea and lake ice (permanent and seasonal) and icebergs.

severeStorms.title: Severe Storms
severeStorms.description: Related to the atmospheric aspect of storms (hurricanes, cyclones, tornadoes, etc.). Results of storms may be included under floods, landslides, etc.

snow.title: Snow
snow.description: Related to snow events, particularly extreme/anomalous snowfall in either timing or extent/depth.

tempExtremes.title: Temperature Extremes
tempExtremes.description: Related to anomalous land temperatures, either heat or cold.

volcanoes.title: Volcanoes
volcanoes.description: Related to both the physical effects of an eruption (rock, ash, lava) and the atmospheric (ash and gas plumes).

waterColor.title: Water Color
waterColor.description: Related to events that alter the appearance of water: phytoplankton, red tide, algae, sediment, whiting, etc.

wildfires.title: Wildfires
wildfires.description: Wildfires includes all nature of fire, including forest and plains fires, as well as urban and industrial fire events. Fires may be naturally caused or manmade.
